body_html:
Thank you, that made it past that error, I am testing or trying to use Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 Community.
…
-- Found CUDA: C:/Program Files/NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit/CUDA/v9.1 (found suitable exact version "9.1") CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:322 (message): Selected compiler (or version) is not supported for CUDA ClCompile: C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.12.25827\bin\HostX86\x64\CL.exe /c /nologo /W0 /WX- /diagnostics:classic /Od /D _MBCS /Gm- /EHsc /RTC1 /MDd /GS /fp:precise /Zc:wchar_t /Zc:forScope /Zc:inline /Fo"Debug\\" /Fd"Debug\vc141.pdb" /Gd /TC /errorReport:queue CMakeCCompilerId.c CMakeCCompilerId.c FYI __VSCMD_PREINIT_LIBPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.12.25827\ATLMFC\lib\x64;.........
On Tue, Feb 13, 2018 at 4:44 PM, Gunhan Gulsoy ***@***.***> wrote: You need to set this to 9.1: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/ tensorflow/contrib/cmake/CMakeLists.txt#L40 You can do it through the command line by -Dtensorflow_CUDA_VERSION=9.1 — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#16939 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABXVTXhUo7m_zzcIWpZgHJXbXo3do_iDks5tUgJMgaJpZM4SBfVz> .
body_text:
Thank you, that made it past that error, I am testing or trying to use
Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 Community.
…
-- Found CUDA: C:/Program Files/NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit/CUDA/v9.1
(found suitable exact version "9.1")
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:322 (message):
  Selected compiler (or version) is not supported for CUDA


ClCompile:
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.12.25827\bin\HostX86\x64\CL.exe /c /nologo /W0 /WX- /diagnostics:classic /Od /D _MBCS /Gm- /EHsc /RTC1 /MDd /GS /fp:precise /Zc:wchar_t /Zc:forScope /Zc:inline /Fo"Debug\\" /Fd"Debug\vc141.pdb" /Gd /TC /errorReport:queue CMakeCCompilerId.c
  CMakeCCompilerId.c

FYI
__VSCMD_PREINIT_LIBPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.12.25827\ATLMFC\lib\x64;.........
On Tue, Feb 13, 2018 at 4:44 PM, Gunhan Gulsoy ***@***.***> wrote:
 You need to set this to 9.1:
 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/
 tensorflow/contrib/cmake/CMakeLists.txt#L40

 You can do it through the command line by -Dtensorflow_CUDA_VERSION=9.1

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#16939 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABXVTXhUo7m_zzcIWpZgHJXbXo3do_iDks5tUgJMgaJpZM4SBfVz>
 .
body:
Thank you, that made it past that error, I am testing or trying to use
Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 Community.

-- Found CUDA: C:/Program Files/NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit/CUDA/v9.1
(found suitable exact version "9.1")
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:322 (message):
  Selected compiler (or version) is not supported for CUDA


ClCompile:
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.12.25827\bin\HostX86\x64\CL.exe /c /nologo /W0 /WX- /diagnostics:classic /Od /D _MBCS /Gm- /EHsc /RTC1 /MDd /GS /fp:precise /Zc:wchar_t /Zc:forScope /Zc:inline /Fo"Debug\\" /Fd"Debug\vc141.pdb" /Gd /TC /errorReport:queue CMakeCCompilerId.c
  CMakeCCompilerId.c

FYI
__VSCMD_PREINIT_LIBPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.12.25827\ATLMFC\lib\x64;.........


On Tue, Feb 13, 2018 at 4:44 PM, Gunhan Gulsoy <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> You need to set this to 9.1:
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/
> tensorflow/contrib/cmake/CMakeLists.txt#L40
>
> You can do it through the command line by -Dtensorflow_CUDA_VERSION=9.1
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/16939#issuecomment-365413959>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABXVTXhUo7m_zzcIWpZgHJXbXo3do_iDks5tUgJMgaJpZM4SBfVz>
> .
>
